com.metreeca.rest

Class Message<T extends Message<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.rest.Message<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the self-bounded message type supporting fluent setters
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Request, Response

    public abstract class Message<T extends Message<T>>
extends Object
    HTTP message.

    Handles shared state/behaviour for HTTP messages and message parts.

    Messages are associated with possibly multiple body representations managed by message body formats.

      • merge

        public T merge(Message<?> message)
        Merge a message into this message.

        Mainly intended to be used inside wrappers to lift for further downstream processing the main message part in multipart requests, as for instance in:

         handler -> request -> request.body(multipart(1000, 10_000)).fold(

     parts -> Optional.ofNullable(parts.get("main"))

         .map(main -> {

           ... // process ancillary body parts

           return handler.handle(request.merge(main));

         })

         .orElseGet(() -> request.reply(new Failure()
             .status(BadRequest)
             .cause("missing main body part")
         )),

     request::reply

 )
        Parameters:
        message - the source message to be merged into this message
        Returns:
        this message modified as follows:
        • source message headers are copied to this message overriding existing values;
        • source message body representations are copied to this message overriding existing values;
        • body representations cached in this message are discarded
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if message is null

      • link

        public Message<?> link(IRI item)
        Creates a linked message.
        Parameters:
        item - the IRI identifying the focus item of the new linked message
        Returns:
        a new linked message with a focus item identified by item and the same originating request as this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if item is null

      • interactive

        public boolean interactive()
        Tests if this message is interactive.
        Returns:
        true if an Accept or Content-Type header of this message include a MIME type usually associated with an interactive browser-managed HTTP exchanges (e.g. text/html

      • charset

        public Optional<String> charset()
        Retrieves the character encoding of this message.
        Returns:
        the character encoding set in the Content-Type header of this message; empty if this message doesn't include a Content-Type header or if no character encoding is explicitly set

      • headers

        Retrieves message headers.
        Returns:
        an immutable and possibly empty map from header names to collections of headers values

      • headers

        public T headers(Map<String,? extends Collection<String>> headers)
        Configures message headers.

        Existing values are overwritten.

        Parameters:
        headers - a map from header names to collections of headers values; empty and duplicate values are ignored
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if headers is null or contains either null keys or null values

      • header

        public Optional<String> header(String name)
        Retrieves message header value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose value is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an optional value containing the first value among those returned by headers(String), if one is present; an empty optional otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null

      • header

        public T header(String name,
                String value)
        Configures message header value.

        If name is prefixed with a tilde (~), header values are set only if the header is not already defined; if name is Set-Cookie or is prefixed with a plus sign (+), header values are appended to existing values; otherwise, header values overwrite existing values.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose value is to be configured
        value - the new value for name; empty values are ignored
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either name or value is null
        See Also:
        RFC 7230 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Message Syntax and Routing - § 3.2.2. Field Order

      • headers

        public Collection<String> headers(String name)
        Retrieves message header values.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose values are to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an immutable and possibly empty collection of values

      • headers

        public T headers(String name,
                 String... values)
        Configures message header values.

        Existing values are overwritten, unless the header name is Set-Cookie or is prefixed with a plus sign (+).

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose values are to be configured
        values - a possibly empty collection of values; empty and duplicate values are ignored
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either name or values is null or if values contains a null value
        See Also:
        RFC 7230 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Message Syntax and Routing - § 3.2.2. Field Order

      • headers

        public T headers(String name,
                 Collection<String> values)
        Configures message header values.

        If name is prefixed with a tilde (~), header values are set only if the header is not already defined; if name is Set-Cookie or is prefixed with a plus sign (+), header values are appended to existing values; otherwise, header values overwrite existing values.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the header whose values are to be configured
        values - a possibly empty collection of values; empty and duplicate values are ignored
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either name or values is null or if values contains a null value
        See Also:
        RFC 7230 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Message Syntax and Routing - § 3.2.2. Field Order

      • body

        public <V> Result<V,Failure> body(Body<V> body)
        Retrieves a body representation.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the body representation managed by body
        Parameters:
        body - the body format managing the body representation to be retrieved
        Returns:
        a result providing access to the body representation managed by body, if one was successfully retrieved from this message; a result providing access to the body processing failure, otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if body is null

      • body

        public <V> T body(Body<V> body,
                  V value)
        Configures a body representation.

        Future calls to body(Body) with the same body format will return the specified value, rather than the value retrieved from this message by the body format.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the body representation managed by body
        Parameters:
        body - the body format managing the body representation to be configured
        value - the body representation to be associated with body
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either body or value is null
        IllegalStateException - if a body value was already retrieved from this message

      • body

        public <V> T body(Body<V> body,
                  Function<T,Result<V,Failure>> generator)
        Configures a body representation.

        Future calls to body(Body) with the same body format will return a value generated from this message, rather than the value retrieved from this message by the body format.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the body representation managed by body
        Parameters:
        body - the body format managing the body representation to be configured
        generator - the value generating function; takes as argument this message and must return either a result with the generated body representation or an error reporting a processing failure
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either body or generator is null
        IllegalStateException - if a body value was already retrieved from this message

      • pipe

        public <V> T pipe(Body<V> body,
                  Function<V,Result<V,Failure>> mapper)
        Process a body representation.

        Future calls to body(Body) with the same body format will pipe the value either explicitly set or retrieved on demand by the body format through a mapping function function.

        Warning / Processing is performed on demand, as final consumer eventually retrieves the processed message body: if mapper relies on information retrieved from the message, its current state must be memoized, before it's possibly altered by downstream wrappers.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the body representation managed by body
        Parameters:
        body - the body format managing the body representation to be processed
        mapper - the value mapping function; takes as argument the original body representation and must return either a result with the mapped representation or an error reporting a processing failure
        Returns:
        this message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either body or mapper is null
        IllegalStateException - if a body value was already retrieved from this message
